summary: Carbon capture technologies could help the federal government meet its goals to reduce carbon dioxide levels in the atmosphere. From FY 2018-2023, the Department of Energy provided about $1.4 billion to fund 654 research and development projects related to carbon capture, use, and storage or directly extracting CO2 from the air. However, the DOE office that handled nearly 70% of funding didn't always follow guidance...
title: Decarbonization: Opportunities Exist to Improve the Department of Energy's Management of Risks to Carbon Capture Projects
